page.title: 14Farming - Part-time Farmers.
page.content: Much of the land in this block is unimproved rough pasture suitable only for sheep grazing. On the lower margins, however, where some improvement has taken place, some beef and dairy cattle are kept. The land generally is too high and the rainfall too heavy for cereal growing even in the most favoured parts - but silage and hay crops are produced for winter feed. The growing season is shorter here than in many parts, and dairy cattle are brought indoors usually in November and are rarely turned out into the fields until early May. Because of the small size of some farms and the unproductive nature of the land, some farms are run by part-time farmers who have other occupations during the daytime.
